Description:
1. Click the menu and at the top left side, navigate to Administration
2. Users tab and verify all users are displayed with correct information
3. Users navigate through pages
     -  verify pagination functionality
Test Data: Valid user data with various roles and statuses

Description:
1. Click different column headers to sort
     - Verify sorting works for all sortable columns
Test Data: Sort by: Name Email Role Status Last Login

Description:
1. Click to open the role filter dropdown
     - Verify dropdown opens with all available roles listed (System Admin / CIC Team / Account Manager / Corporate Affairs / Management / PSBG Engineers / Alert Group)
     - Click anywhere on screen to close it
     - Open the filter and click 1 more time to close it
2. Verify the filter function
    - Select System Admin > Verify users "John Smith" & "Jane Doe" are displayed
    - And select Account Manager > Verify users matched either roles: "John Smith", "Jane Doe" & "James Smith" are displayed
    - Clear all filters and verify all users return to view
Test Data:
Roles: System Admin / CIC Team / Account Manager / Corporate Affairs / Management / PSBG Engineers / Alert Group

Expected users: John Smith , Jane Doe, James Smith

Description:
1. Locate active user Mike Johnson in the user list
     - Verify current status shows Active with green status badge
     - Click toggle switch to disable user
     - Verify user status changes to Inactive with red status badge
     - Verify confirmation popup User [name] has been disabled appears
2. Verify user can no longer access platform (if login testing available)
3. Click toggle switch again to re-enable user
     - Verify status returns to Active
Test Data: Active user: Mike Johnson

Description:
1. Locate inactive user Sarah Wilson in the user list
     - Click Delete button (trash icon) on user row
     - Verify confirmation dialog opens asking to confirm or cancel deletion
     - Click Confirm button in dialog
3. Verify user is permanently removed from user list
4. Verify confirmation message User has been deleted successfully appears
5. Verify deleted user no longer appears in any filtered views
Test Data: User: Sarah Wilson (Inactive user)

Description:
1. Locate and click the status filter dropdown
     - Verify dropdown shows All Statuses, Active, and Inactive options
2. Select Active from the dropdown options
     - Verify only users with Active status (John Smith, Jane Doe, Mike Johnson) are displayed
3. Change filter to Inactive
     - Verify only inactive users (Sarah Wilson) are displayed
4. Select All Statuses to reset filter
     - Verify all users return to the list view
Test Data:
Filter: Active status
Expected active users: John Smith / Jane Doe / Mike Johnson

Description:

4. Clear search box and verify all users return to list

User
Name: John Smith 
Email: john.smith@clp.com.hk

Search terms: 
1. john
2. john.smith@clp.com.hk
3. XYZ123

Email: arthur.smith@clp.com.hk

Description:
1. Locate user [Arthur Smith] in the user list
     - Click Edit button (pencil icon) on user row
     - Verify Edit and Delete buttons change to Save and Cancel buttons
     - Verify role field becomes editable while name and email remain read-only

2. Verify changes are applied and reflected in user list
3. Verify confirmation message User [name] has been updated appears

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
     - Verify bulk upload modal opens with download template option
2. Click Download Sample CSV Template link
     - Verify CSV template downloads with required columns (StaffID, Role)
3. Create test CSV file with 5 valid user records
     - Click Upload CSV button and select the test file
     -  Verify file upload progress indicator displays
     - Verify import summary modal shows successful import statistics
4. Verify new users appear in user list with correct information

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
2. Select Manual Input radio button option
     - Verify customer account input field and Load Preference button are displayed
3. Enter Customer Account B1012345 in the input field
     - Click Load Preference button to retrieve current customer preferences
     - Verify channel preferences (App Push, SMS, Email) are displayed with current opt-in/out status
     - Change Email toggles as opt-out position
     - Click Save button to update customer preferences
7. Verify confirmation message Customer preference updated successfully appears
8. Verify updated preferences persist and are applied to future notifications
     - For example, send a manual notification to CA: B1012345 by email
Test Data:
Customer Data
Account: B1012345; Test channels: App Push SMS Email; Expected status changes

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
     - Select Bulk Upload radio button option
     - Verify file upload interface and instructions are displayed
2. Click Download Sample CSV Template link
     - Verify sample CSV downloads with required columns (Customer Account, App Push, SMS, Email)
3. Create test CSV file with 2 customer opt-out preference records
     CA1: AD1234 / Y / Y / Y & CA2: AD1234 / Y / Y / N
     - Click file upload area and select the test CSV file
4. Verify file upload progress indicator displays
5. Click Upload button to process the bulk update
6. Verify import summary modal shows successful update statistics and any errors
7. Verify bulk preference changes are applied to all customers in the CSV
     - Send a manual notification of email to CA1 & CA2 to test functionality
Test Data: CSV with 10 customer records; File format: Customer Account App Push SMS Email; Test both opt-in and opt-out values

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Opt-out Exception Report
     - Click to open the Opt-out Exception Report window
2. Verify report interface opens with date filter and customer search options
     - Select Today from the date filter dropdown options
     - Verify report data refreshes to match the applied filters
3. Enter customer account B1012345 in the customer search field
     - Verify accumulated records of wrong opt-out replies are displayed
4. Review report data columns (Date, Customer Account, Reply Time, Reply Message)
5. Click "X" button to close the report window
6. Verify window closes and returns to settings page
Test Data:
Customer Data
Customer account: B1012345

Action: Enable daily opt-out exception report email
Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Roles tab
2. Locate role [Account Manager]
     - Click Edit button on the selected role card
     - In the permissions list, locate "Receive Alert message"
     - Check the checkbox to enable this permission for the role
     - Click Save button to update role permissions
     - Verify confirmation message appears for successful permission update
3. Verify email delivery is enabled for users with the configured permission
4. Test that daily opt-out exception report emails are sent to users in [Account Manager]
5. Verify email contains Excel format data, which is same as "opt-out exception records" in #18
Test Data: Role: System Admin; Email: enabled; Permission: Receive opt-out exception report; Test email delivery

Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Roles tab
2. Verify all predefined roles are displayed in card format (System Admin, CIC Team, Account Manager, Corporate Affairs, Management, PSBG Engineers, User)
3. For each role card verify the following information is displayed:
   - Role name as header
   - Number of active users assigned to role
   - Edit and Delete action buttons
   - Complete list of permissions with granted/denied status indicated by checkmarks/X marks
4. Verify role cards are properly arranged in grid layout
Test Data:
Default roles
System Admin
CIC Team
Account Manager
Corporate Affairs
Management
PSBG Engineers
User

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
   - Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
   - Enter role name "Custom Test Role" in the name field
   - Review available permissions list and select the following permissions: Full Dashboard Access & Send Notifications & Download Data
   - Verify selected permissions show as checked with green checkmarks
   - Click Save button to create the role 
2. Verify success message Role [Custom Test Role] has been created successfully appears
3. Verify new role appears in roles grid with correct permissions and 0 users count
Test Data:
Role name: Custom Test 
Permissions: Full Dashboard Access Send Notifications Download Data

Description:
1. Locate Account Manager role card in the roles grid
     - Click Edit button (pencil icon) on the Account Manager role card
     - Verify role edit modal opens with current role name and permissions pre-selected
     - Add Template Management permission by checking the checkbox
     - Remove Outage Management permission by unchecking the checkbox
     - Verify permission changes are reflected visually in the modal
     - Click Save button to apply changes
2. Verify confirmation message Permissions for role [Account Manager] have been updated appears
3. Verify Account Manager role card shows updated permissions in the grid
Test Data: Role: Account Manager; Add: Template Management permission; Remove: Outage Management permission

Description:
1. Ensure [Custom Test] Role exists and has no assigned users (0 users count)
     - Locate [Custom Test] Role card in the roles grid
     - Click Delete button (trash icon) on the role card
     - Verify confirmation dialog opens with warning message about permanent deletion
     - Click Confirm button in the confirmation dialog
     - Verify role is immediately removed from the roles grid
2. Verify success message Role has been deleted successfully appears
3. Verify deleted role no longer appears in any role dropdowns throughout the application
Test Data: Role: Custom Test Role (with no assigned users); Prerequisite: Role must exist and have 0 assigned users

Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and locate Setting tab
     - Expand System settings section by clicking the header
     - Locate Data Retention settings
2. Verify current retention period values are displayed
     - Click on data retention input field and change value to 365 days
     - Verify input fields only accept positive integer values
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
4. Verify confirmation message Data retention periods have been updated successfully appears
5. Refresh page and verify both settings persist correctly
6. Verify retention policies are applied to future data management

1. Navigate to Administration section and locate Setting tab
     - Expand System settings section by clicking the header
     - Locate Auto-Update Interval settings
2. Verify current auto-update interval value is displayed clearly
     - Click on the interval input field and change value to 30 minutes
     - Verify input accepts only positive integer values
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
3. Verify confirmation message Auto-update interval has been updated successfully appears
4. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 30 minutes
5. Test that the updated interval is applied to future interim notifications

1. Navigate to Administration section and locate Setting tab
     - Expand System settings section by clicking the header
     - Locate max update limit
2. Verify current maximum number of updates value is displayed
     - Click on the max updates input field
     - Change value to 3 updates
     - Verify field only accepts positive integer values
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
3. Verify confirmation message Maximum update limit has been updated successfully appears
4. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 5 updates
5. Test that updates are blocked when the configured limit is reached

1. Navigate to Administration section and locate Setting tab
     - Expand System settings section by clicking the header
     - Locate the Internal communication toggle
2. Verify current status (Enabled/Disabled) is displayed clearly
     - Click toggle switch to change from current state
     - !Trigger the existing communication checking which ongoing notification continue to proceed
     - Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
2. Verify toggle switch changes state and save confirmation appears
3. Verify success message Internal communication setting has been updated successfully
4. Test that all active internal communication processes continue to proceed
5. Verify internal notification functionality respects the new setting

1. Navigate to Administration section and locate Setting tab
     - Expand System settings section by clicking the header
     - Locate the external communication toggle
2. Verify current status (Enabled/Disabled) is displayed clearly
     - Click toggle switch to change from current state
     - !Trigger the existing communication checking which ongoing notification continue to proceed
     - Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
3. Verify toggle switch changes state and save confirmation appears
4. Verify success message External communication setting has been updated successfully
5. Verify that all active external communication processes continue to proceed
6. Verify external notification functionality respects the new setting

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Trigger Mode section
     - Expand Trigger Mode group by clicking the header
     - Verify current Auto Trigger and Manual Trigger toggle states are displayed
2. Click Auto Trigger toggle to enable (ON position)
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
     - Verify toggle states are visually updated with correct labels
     - Verify confirmation message Trigger mode settings have been updated successfully appears
     - Verify settings persist after page refresh
     - Test the auto-triggering notification function correctly
3. Click Manual Trigger toggle to disable (OFF position)
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
     - Verify toggle states are visually updated with correct labels
     - Verify confirmation message Trigger mode settings have been updated successfully appears
     - Verify settings persist after page refresh
     - Test to send manual notification function is disabled

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Trigger Mode section
     - Expand Trigger Mode settings group by clicking the header
     - Locate Extreme Weather Mode toggle switch
2. Verify current extreme weather mode status is displayed clearly
     - Click toggle switch to enable Extreme Weather Mode (ON position)
     - Verify warning popup appears stating system will continue to send all ongoing messages
     - Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
3. Verify toggle switch changes to ON position with visual confirmation
4. Verify confirmation message appears for successful activation
5. Verify mode status persists after page refresh
6. Test that system uses extreme weather message templates when mode is enabled
7. Test that system apply the extreme weather delay when mode is enabled

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Delay Control section
     - Expand Delay Control section by clicking the header
2. Verify current Delay Before External Send (Minutes) value is displayed
     - Update the delay value to 10 minutes in the input field
     - Verify field only accepts positive integer values
     - Click Save button to apply the delay setting
3. Verify confirmation message Delay Time has been updated successfully appears
4. Verify the updated delay value 10 minutes persists after page refresh
5. Send manual notification to test that extreme weather notifications are delayed by the configured time

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Delay Control section
     - Expand Delay Control settings group by clicking the header
2. Locate Delay Before External Send under Extreme Weather section
     - Verify current extreme weather delay value is displayed
3. Click on the extreme weather delay input field
     - Change value to 15 minutes in the input field
     - Verify field only accepts positive integer values
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
4. Verify confirmation message Extreme weather delay has been updated successfully appears
5. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 15 minutes
6. Send manual notification to test that extreme weather notifications are delayed by the configured time

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Alert Message Triggering section
     - Expand Alert Message Triggering settings group by clicking the header
2. Verify current alert time between stage 1 & stage 3 is displayed in minutes
     - Click on the alert time input field
     - Change value to 45 minutes
     - Verify field only accepts positive integer values
     - Click Save button in the settings actions section
     - Verify confirmation message Alert time has been updated successfully appears
3. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 45 minutes
4. Test that alert notifications are triggered after the configured time when stage 3 is delayed

1. Click Add New User button in the action buttons section
     - Verify popup form opens with input fields for StaffID and Role
     - Enter invalid StaffID 99999 in the StaffID field
     - Verify system attempts to auto-fill name and email fields
     - Verify error message appears stating User not found or StaffID does not exist
     - Verify name and email fields remain empty or show error indicators
2. Click Cancel to close the modal without creating user
3. Verify no new user is added to the user list
Test Data: Invalid StaffID: 99999; Expected error: User not found; Verify auto-fill failure

Description:
1. Click Add New User button in the action buttons section
     - Verify popup form opens with input fields for StaffID and Role
     - Enter existing StaffID 93313 (already exists in system)
     - Verify system auto-fills name and email fields correctly
     - Select any role from the role dropdown
     - Click Create button to attempt user creation
     - Verify error message appears stating User already exists or Duplicate StaffID
     - Verify system prevents duplicate user creation
2. Verify original user remains unchanged in the user list
3. Click Cancel to close the modal
Test Data: Existing StaffID: 93313; Expected error: User already exists; Verify duplicate prevention

Action: Delete user assigned to role in use
Description:
1. Locate user [Arthur Smith] who is currently assigned to an active role and has system dependencies
     - Click Delete button (trash icon) on the user row
     - Verify confirmation dialog opens with warning about user deletion
     - Click Confirm button to attempt deletion
     - Verify system displays error message preventing deletion
     - Verify error message explains user has active role assignments or dependencies
2. Verify user remains in the user list unchanged
3. Verify system suggests removing role assignments first before deletion
4. Close any error dialogs and verify user status remains unchanged
Test Data: User [Arthur Smith] with active role assignments; Expected error: Cannot delete user with active roles; Suggest remove assignments first

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
     - Verify bulk upload modal opens with file selection options
2. Create test CSV file with 2 users, one missing required StaffID column (only Role column present)
     - Click Upload CSV button and select the invalid CSV file
     - Verify system attempts to process the file
     - Verify detailed error message appears listing missing required columns
     - Verify error message specifically mentions Missing required column: StaffID
3. Verify no users are imported due to format validation failure
4. Verify import summary shows 1 successful imports and format error details
5. Close error modal and verify only 1 user added
Test Data:
User data
Staff ID: 90001
Role: System Admin, CIC Team

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
     - Verify bulk upload modal opens with file selection options
2. Create or select test CSV file larger than 10MB file size limit
     - Click Upload CSV button and select the oversized file
     - Verify system attempts to validate file before processing
     - Verify file size error message appears immediately
     - Verify error message states File size exceeds maximum limit of 10MB
3. Verify file upload is rejected and no processing occurs
4. Verify import process does not start due to size validation
5. Close error modal and verify no changes to user list
Test Data: CSV file size: 15MB; Expected error: File size exceeds 10MB limit; Verify size validation

Description:
1. Locate the search input box with placeholder Search for user by name
     - Enter non-existent user name NonExistentUser in the search box
2. Verify search executes automatically as user types
3. Verify user list becomes empty showing no matching results
4. Verify No users found message displays prominently in the table area
5. Verify message is clear and user-friendly
6. Clear the search box by deleting all text
     - Verify all users return to the list view
     - Verify search functionality works correctly for subsequent searches

1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
     - Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
     - Enter existing role name [System Admin] in the name field
     - Select any permissions from the available permissions list
     - Click Save button to attempt role creation
2. Verify error message appears preventing duplicate role creation
3. Verify error message states Role name already exists or similar validation message
4. Verify system prevents saving the duplicate role
5. Verify original System Admin role remains unchanged
6. Click Cancel to close the modal without creating duplicate role

1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
     - Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
     - Leave role name field completely blank (empty)
     - Select some permissions from the available permissions list
     - Click Save button to attempt role creation
2. Verify validation error message appears for empty role name
3. Verify no role is created due to validation failure

1. Locate [Account Manager] role card which has assigned users [Arthur Smith]
2. Click Delete button (trash icon) on the System Admin role card
     - Verify confirmation dialog opens for role deletion
     - Click Confirm button to attempt deletion
     - Verify system displays error message preventing deletion
     - Verify error message explains role cannot be deleted because it is only assigned role for user
     - Verify error suggests removing user assignments before deletion
3. Close error dialog and verify [Account Manager] role remains unchanged in the roles grid
4. Verify role user count and permissions remain intact
Test Data: Role: Account Manager (with Arthur Smith assigned)

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
     - Select Manual Input radio button option
     - Enter invalid customer account X9999999 in the input field
     - Click Load Preference button to attempt retrieving preferences
2. Verify system attempts to lookup customer account
     - Verify error message appears stating Customer not found or Account does not exist
3. Verify customer preferences section remains empty or shows error state
4. Verify error message is clear and helpful for user
5. Clear the invalid account and verify field resets properly
6. Test with another invalid format to verify consistent error handling

1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
     - Select Bulk Upload radio button option
2. Create test CSV file with 2 CA no, which 1 with wrong format (missing Customer Account column)
     - Add some invalid customer account numbers in the CSV
     - Click file upload area and select the invalid CSV file
     -  Click Upload button to attempt processing the file
3. Verify system validates CSV format and data
4. Verify detailed error report appears listing specific issues
5. Verify error report shows missing columns and invalid customer accounts
6. Verify no preference changes are applied due to validation failures
7. Verify summary shows 1 successful updates and detailed error breakdown

1. Determine current system user capacity limit (if configurable)
2. Navigate to user management and verify current user count
     - Add users until approaching the maximum system capacity
     - Attempt to add one more user when at maximum limit
     - Click Add New User button at system capacity limit
     - Enter valid StaffID and role information
     - Click Create button to attempt adding user at limit
3. Verify system handles limit gracefully with appropriate message
4. Verify error message explains system capacity has been reached
5. Verify existing users remain functional and unchanged
6. Verify system suggests capacity increase or user cleanup options
Test Data: System at max user limit

Description:
1. Open multiple browser tabs or sessions with administration access
2. Navigate to user management in all sessions
3. Simultaneously perform edit operations on different users
     - Rapidly click edit/save/delete buttons in quick succession
     - Attempt concurrent operations on the same user from different sessions
4. Verify system handles concurrent operations without conflicts
5. Verify data integrity is maintained during rapid operations
6. Verify appropriate locking or conflict resolution mechanisms
7. Verify error messages for conflicting operations are clear
8. Verify system remains stable under rapid user interaction load
9. Verify audit logs capture all operations correctly

1. Navigate to user management section
     - Apply role filter by selecting System Admin from role dropdown
     - Verify filtered results show only System Admin users
     - Additionally apply status filter by selecting Active status
     - Verify combined filtering shows only Active System Admin users
2. Add name search criteria while filters are active
     - Verify search works within the already filtered results
3. Clear filters one by one and verify results update correctly
     - Apply multiple role selections simultaneously (System Admin + CIC Team)
     - Verify multiple criteria filtering works correctly across all filter types
4. Test edge combinations like Active status + multiple roles + partial name search

1. Navigate to user management and verify full user list is displayed
     - Click Name column header to sort ascending
     - Verify ascending sort indicator (up arrow) appears and data is sorted correctly
2. Click Name column again to sort descending
     - Verify descending sort indicator (down arrow) appears
3. Click Email column header and verify sort changes to email field
     - Repeat sorting test for Role, Status, and Last Login columns
4. Test sorting with filtered results (apply filter then sort)
     - Verify sort persists when navigating between pages in pagination
5. Test sorting with large datasets to verify performance
     - Verify sort indicators are visually clear and correct for all sortable columns

1. Create test scenario with 150+ users in the system (or simulate)
2. Navigate to user management to view the large user dataset
     - Verify pagination controls appear at bottom of user table
     - Verify page numbers and navigation arrows are displayed
3. Click through multiple pages using page number buttons
     - Test First Page, Previous Page, Next Page, Last Page navigation
     - Verify user data loads correctly on each page without duplicates
4. Apply filters and verify pagination adjusts to filtered results
5. Test sorting across paginated results
6. Test performance with large datasets during page navigation
Test Data: Dataset with 150+ users; Expected: Smooth pagination; Verify performance with large datasets

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button to open role creation modal
     - Enter unique role name [Maximum Permission Role]
     - Review complete list of available permissions
     - Select all available permissions by checking every permission checkbox
     - Verify all permissions show as selected with proper visual indicators
     - Click Save button to create role with all permissions
2. Verify role is created successfully with all permissions granted
     - Review role card to confirm all permissions are displayed correctly
3. Test role functionality by assigning to test user (if possible)
4. Verify system performance with maximum permission role
5. Verify role displays properly in role selection dropdowns
Test Data: All available permissions selected; Expected: Successful creation; Verify performance with maximum permissions

Action: Edit role while users are active
Description:
1. Identify a role that has active users currently logged into the system
     - Navigate to role management and locate the role with active users
2. Click Edit button on the role card to open editing modal
     - Modify some permissions for the role (add or remove permissions)
     - Click Save to apply permission changes while users are active
3. Verify system handles the role modification gracefully
4. Test if permission changes take effect immediately for active users
5. Verify no active sessions are interrupted by role modifications
6. Verify audit logs capture role changes with active user context
7. Test edge cases like removing critical permissions from active users
Test Data: Active users with role being modified; Expected: Graceful handling; Verify immediate permission updates

Description:
1. Schedule or simulate system maintenance mode
     - Navigate to Settings tab during maintenance window
     - Attempt to modify various settings (intervals, delays, communication toggles)
2. Verify system behavior during maintenance mode
     - Verify appropriate messaging about maintenance mode if applicable
3. Test if settings changes are queued or blocked during maintenance
4. Verify data integrity of settings during maintenance operations
5. Test settings persistence after maintenance window ends
     - Verify no settings corruption occurs during maintenance
6. Verify proper error handling and user messaging during maintenance
7. Test rollback scenarios if settings changes fail during maintenance
Test Data: During maintenance mode; Expected: Appropriate handling; Verify data integrity during maintenance

Description:
1. Open administration settings in multiple browser tabs or user sessions
     - Navigate to different settings sections in each session
2. Simultaneously modify different settings from multiple sessions
     - Test concurrent changes to the same setting from different sessions
     - Click Save buttons simultaneously from multiple sessions
3. Verify system handles concurrent settings modifications properly
4. Verify last-saved-wins or conflict resolution mechanism
5. Verify no settings corruption occurs from simultaneous changes
6. Verify appropriate error messages for conflicting operations
7. Verify audit logs capture all concurrent settings changes correctly
Test Data: Two admins modifying settings concurrently; Expected: Conflict resolution; Verify data integrity

Description:
1. Create test CSV file with 10000+ customer opt-out preference records
     - Ensure CSV file is properly formatted with required columns
2. Navigate to Settings tab and select Bulk Upload option
3. Upload the large CSV file (10000+ records)
     - Click Upload button to start processing large batch operation
     - Monitor system performance during large batch processing
     - Verify progress indicators work correctly for large datasets
     - Verify system remains responsive during bulk processing
     - Verify memory and CPU usage remain within acceptable limits
     - Verify batch processing completes successfully without timeouts
     - Verify import summary accurately reports results for large dataset
4. Test system stability after large batch operation completion
Test Data: CSV with 10000+ records; Expected: Successful processing; Verify performance and system stability

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate communication toggle switches
2. Rapidly click External Communication toggle multiple times in quick succession
     - Verify system handles rapid toggle operations without errors
     - Test rapid toggling of Internal Communication switch
     - Rapidly toggle between Extreme Weather Mode on/off states
3. Verify each toggle operation registers correctly despite rapid clicking
4. Verify system state consistency after rapid toggle operations
5. Test warning dialogs appear and function correctly during rapid toggling
6. Verify no race conditions or state corruption occurs
7. Verify final switch states match the last intentional toggle action

Action: Database connection failure during user add
Description:
1. Set up scenario to simulate database connectivity issues (if possible in test environment)
2. Navigate to user management and click Add New User button
     - Enter valid StaffID and role information in the form
     - Simulate database connection failure during save operation
     - Click Create button to trigger database operation during failure
3. Verify system displays appropriate error message about database connectivity
4. Verify error message is user-friendly and doesn't expose technical details
5. Verify user creation operation is properly rolled back
6. Verify no partial user data is saved in inconsistent state
7. Verify system provides guidance on next steps or retry options
8. Verify audit logs capture the database failure event appropriately

1. Navigate to user management and start editing a user
     - Click Edit button on any user row to enter edit mode
     - Make some changes to user role but don't save immediately
     - Wait for user session to timeout (or force session expiration)
     - Attempt to click Save button after session has expired
2. Verify system detects session timeout and handles appropriately
3. Verify user is redirected to login page or session renewal prompt
4. Verify unsaved changes are handled gracefully (lost with warning or preserved)
5. Verify clear messaging about session expiration to user
6. Verify session timeout doesn't corrupt any existing user data

1. Set up two admin sessions accessing same user management interface
     - Navigate to user management in both sessions
2. Add a [Test user] for concurrent deletion
3. Select the same user (e.g., test user) for deletion in both sessions
